data.text: @bert_hu_bert Do you also have a graph with socioeconomic activity and mood sentiments to plot alongside? While “not living” may translate into “not getting ill” in the short run, “not living” will also translate into “getting ill” in the long run. There are more perspectives to be considered.
@bert_hu_bert @hendriksmj je gaat hier nou toch niet ook nog een anti carnaval campagne voeren op Twitter he, ouwe bumperrrrrr 😆
@bert_hu_bert And the Carnaval was great. Tested positive on Wednesday, hardly any signs of covid, out of quarantaine today. Live goes on!

@bert_hu_bert Carnaval *area.
Obviously I don't live in the carnaval 🤣

@bert_hu_bert I live in the carnaval (which is something different than carnival 😉). Did not celebrate it. And here I am, in quarantaine together with my husband. Luckily both triple vaccinated, it feels like a bad cold. 
Kind of cosy, together at home 🥰

@bert_hu_bert 😂

Just of the phone with RIVM, q to send in results of my antigen tests. Not getting covid in these circumstances as a scientific miracle!
@gertjanbruggink "Only afterwards did I find out I was part of the control group!"
@bert_hu_bert So glad I could contribute to this experiment. It was my pleasure. Anything for science.
@jelle_n @bert_hu_bert Some would argue they won’t have a memory of it. Would that be the control group? Or the placebo?
